hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $250$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $2{,}500$.

Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
$\searrow\goldD2$ | $\searrow\purpleD5$ | $\searrow\blueD0$ | $\cancel0$ 
 | $\goldD2$ | $\purpleD5$ | $\blueD0$ 


Moving each digit of $2{,}500$ to the right means dividing by $10$:

$\goldD2{,}\purpleD5\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10 = \goldD2\purpleD5\blueD0$ so,

$\goldD2{,}\purpleD5\blueD0\greenD0 \div \goldD2\purpleD5\blueD0 = 10$

question.content:
**Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**
  

$2{,}500$ [[☃ dropdown 1]] $250=10$
